summary: Build an app (UI based on a provided image) that lets the user enter marks and automatically calculates results, keeping the output format identical to the image.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Clean report-card form background with table lines and headings similar to the uploaded image, no handwritten marks, no logos (report-card-form.dim_1600x1100.png)

existing_features.title: Recreate the report-card/table layout shown in the uploaded image as the main screen of the app, keeping headings, sections, and column structure visually consistent with the image.

Provide editable inputs for entering marks per subject for: 1st Unit Test, 2nd Unit Test, Half Yearly (out of 100), and Annual Exam (out of 100). The rest of the columns must auto-calculate and render in-place in the same row.

Implement the calculations shown by the table headers: (a) Total Marks under EXAMINATIONS = 1st Unit Test + 2nd Unit Test; (b) X = 20% of UT Total Marks; (c) Y = 30% of Half Yearly marks; (d) Z = 50% of Annual Exam marks; (e) Total 100 Marks = X + Y + Z.

Include the same subject list as shown in the image as default rows: English, English II, Mathematics, Hindi, EVS, G.K., Social Studies/Science, Science, Assamese, Computer, Drawing, Conversation, Health & Physical Education; plus a 'Total' row and a 'Percentage' row.

Add editing for the lower-section inputs shown in the image: (a) 'Fields' table items (Work Experience, Regularity, Punctuality, Cleanliness, Indigenous Sports, School Programmes, Visual and Performing Art) with Half Yearly and Annual entries; (b) Attendance Records: Total Working Days and Present Days; (c) Result and Remarks text entries.

Add basic validation and inline feedback: marks should be within 0â€“100 for Half Yearly and Annual; Unit Test inputs should be non-negative and clearly labeled (if max is unknown, do not enforce an upper bound for UT inputs, but still prevent negatives).
Provide a Print-friendly view so the filled form can be printed from the browser while keeping the output format closely matching the image (table borders, spacing, and headings retained).

Choose and apply a coherent visual theme that matches a paper report-card aesthetic (e.g., warm off-white background, dark gray/black text, subtle border lines), and enforce it consistently across the page.
Use a generated clean background form image (matching the provided layout) as a static asset and render inputs/values aligned on top of it so the on-screen output closely resembles the image.
